repnme.cdata!:
Serbia - Energy Community of South East
            Europe (APL) Program : Serbia  Component

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Energy Community of
            South East Europe Program Project for Serbia were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was moderate; Bank and Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: an Adaptable Program Lending (APL)
            instrument in conjunction with a sound planning or
            analytical effort are an appropriate approach to ensure the
            success of infrastructure projects characterized by the
            incremental implementation of proven technologies. The
            flexible APL approach facilitated also carrying on a
            procurement plan that adapted its design to market
            conditions and consequently achieved greater competition.
            Projects including both policy reform and infrastructure
            (physical) components pose additional challenges that
            require synchronized design and implementation. Two issues
            to consider in this respect are: providing a carefully
            designed technical assistance for specific parts of the
            reform agenda, and the coordination of both policy reform
            and physical components could benefit from a more specific
            definition of performance indicators. The active role of the
            government is paramount in addressing the conflict between
            economic growth and environmental protection objectives. The
            challenges faced by executing agencies during a reform
            process justify an additional support tailored to their
            specific needs. The evaluation of long-term results requires
            a Monitoring and Evaluation (M and E) effort beyond project
            closure and broad in scope.

repnme.cdata!:
Serbia and Montenegro - Energy Community of
            South East Europe (APL-2) Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Energy Community of
            South East Europe (APL-2) Project is to improve electricity
            market access for consumers and suppliers through increase
            in the quantity, quality, reliability, safety and efficiency
            of the bulk power transmission system, and strengthen
            capacity of the institutions to participate in the regional
            electricity market. The closing of the project will be
            extended from December 31, 2011, until June 30, 2012. All
            major installation works are expected to be completed on
            site and all project funds will be disbursed by June,
            2012.This will be the second extension of the closing date
            and will result in a cumulative extension of over two years
            from the original closing date (February 28, 2010).

display_title.display_title:
Serbia and Montenegro - Energy
            Community of South East Europe (APL-2) Project :
            restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
